text:
Jurgen Klopp speaks on Mamadou Sakho's Liverpool future Share this video Watch Next 
Jurgen Klopp has dropped his biggest hint yet that Mamadou Sakho could remain at Liverpool. 
The Frenchman completed a January transfer deadline day loan switch to Crystal Palace after being frozen out by Reds boss Klopp, writes Mirror Football's Thomas Bristow. 
The German sent Sakho home from Liverpool's pre-season tour of the USA early after the 26-year-old displayed multiple cases of tardiness. 
Speaking in his press conference, the Reds boss said: "This is not place for me to give advice to Mamadou. Who knows what will change in 5 months? He still has contract at LFC." Klopp admits he could see red again Klopp admits he struggles to keep his emotions in check on the sidelines (Photo: REUTERS) 
Jurgen Klopp admits he cannot control his emotions on the touchline. 
The Liverpool manager said he was lucky to get away with bawling “Nobody can beat us” in the face of fourth ­official Neil Swarbrick when Simon Mignolet saved Diego Costa’s penalty in the 1-1 draw with Chelsea on Tuesday. 
Klopp, embarrassed by his outburst, is grateful to ­Swarbrick for not sending him to the stands, writes Mirror Football's David Anderson. 
He says he tries hard to behave, but cannot promise he won’t lose it again in the heat of the moment. 
“I can’t give a guarantee that it won’t happen again,” he said. “I could say now that it won’t, but that would be a lie. That’s why there are fines for it. If we go over the top, then give us a fine. It’s right that we should pay the penalty. Read More
